alert.note: Alert for Greene; Pickens; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 09 at 4:03AM CDT until April 10 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock and Dam affecting Pickens, Sumter and Greene Counties. .Recent heavy rainfall has produced rises over the Tombigbee River basin and a flood warning is now in effect for the Tombigbee River near Bevill Lock and Dam. Another statement will be issued by this evening, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock and Dam. * WHEN...From this evening to early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 122.0 feet, Cattle in low-lying areas of Southern Pickens County should be moved to higher ground. Cattle are cutoff in lowlands of Southern Pickens County at stages above 122 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 121.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 122.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 122.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
